intro: Eriocaulon dalzellii var. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth eriocaulon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and small, grass-like leaves. The plant produces spikelets that are typically clustered at the base of the stems. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions, often found in wet or marshy habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
